Loan Policy

Read the summary text. Select CLOSE when you are finished reviewing the summary text.

You discover this excerpt from the loan policy:

...

 

The Chief Credit Officer (CCO) has an unsecured lending authority limit of $50M. The CCO has authority to approve over-drafts to loan customers in good standing up to his unsecured lending limit. For customers without a loan relationship, the Chief Credit Officer may approve overdrafts up to $15M. Loan officers have authority to waive overdraft fees for one transaction every 6 months.

Examiner Reference Tool - Task 10
